text: Jean Baptiste Charbonneau (11 February 1805 â€“ 16 May 1866) was the son of Toussaint Charbonneau and Sacagawea. He was a fur trapper and guide. He was an important figure in the Mexican-American War. Charbonneau and his mother are pictured on a one-dollar coin. Category:1805 births Category:1866 deaths Category:Native American people
title: Jean Baptiste Charbonneau
